item.description:

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
Maxey:

We are never going to get those effects back, deal with it.

It was something exclusive to the Gamecube/Wii versions.

As it stands, it looks really good. Smooth, sharp 60fps gameplay.

Won’t it be possible to “hack-in” those effects as post-processing using dll files, with ENB series for example?

Read full topic

item.source: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Yeah I was gonna hop on here and say. Digging through the internet only gets you forum posts and wiki posts almost all of which a disputed. I am pretty sure if they were using a 3rd party engine you could find out what engine specifically it was. Also if you look up interviews about the Wii version of Dead Rising they state it runs of the “Resident Evil 4” engine lending more evidence to them preferring internal engines.

Read full topic
item.source: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
GiantBomb is a great site but I wouldn’t trust their “wiki” section as 100% accurate.

There were a couple or just one Resident Evil spin-off games that indeed used an id Soft engine and those were the Outbreak games, which used the Quake 3 engine.

All the mainline games in the series use proprietary engines and most of the spin-off games too.

Read full topic
item.source: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
https://www.giantbomb.com/quake-engine/3015-1278/

EDIT: you are correct, it indeed is shit, Resident Evil came out before Quake even did.

Read full topic

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC
item.dc:creator: Lemonz_amp_amp_orang
item.description:
Dotard:

The game would become too easy.

wii version had high precision aiming mode (where the wii sensor gimmick actually benefited the gameplay), and that made the wii version imo the superior port

if the pc has mouse aiming, then it will pretty much stack up/exceed wii version

item.source: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
There was a post by a Capcom person on the Steam forums talking about what the graphics stuff is like.

There’s an option to switch between standard and HD textures, resolutions above 1080p are allowed but 1080p is the highest that was officially tested (although the guy posting said that 1200p, 1440p, and 1600p worked well for him, support for 16:10 but no mention or whether or not there will be letterboxing), up to 8x msaa, low/med/high shadow option, and a motion blur option. Apparently there are more in a config file somewhere. All cutscenes are rendered in engine except for, like someone guessed earlier, the Separate Ways part.

He also mentions a “fun” graphics option that he didn’t elaborate on. I wonder what that could be.

Read full topic
item.source: Resident Evil 4 Ultimate HD Edition PC
